name: CheckIn
text message: Have you been able to ignore your child's tantrums or other negative demanding behaviours? How has it been?

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: Well done! Ignoring negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours is not easy. Good for you for giving it a try and being consistent!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry you did not manage well. Ignoring our children's whining or tantrums is really hard. Please be patient with yourself.

name: CheckIn
text message: What was difficult about using ignore?
option 1: It was hard to stay calm while ignoring my child's tantrum
option 2: I struggled to be consistent and gave into their demands
option 3: I am concerned about my child or someone else getting hurt
option 4: I am having to ignore my child's behaviour all the time

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: I know, it can be really difficult to stay calm when our children are whining or having a tantrum. Try to think of something that you can do to help like taking a pause. You can do this!

name: CheckIn
text message: If you are finding that you are ignoring your child's behaviour a lot, then your child is probably not getting enough positive attention at other times. Try to spend more One-on-One Time with your child!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sometimes, our children can have very violent tantrums when they do not get their way, especially if they are used to it. Try to move your child to a place where they will not hurt themselves or others. You may need to firmly hold your child while ignoring their behaviour - but only do this if you can remain calm and  make sure you are not hurting them! Eventually, your child will calm down.

name: CheckIn
text message: I know, it is hard to be consistent! If you ignore a behaviour only some of the time, your child will think it might help them get their way. The more consistent you are, the less they will do it.
